original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields close higher, rupee at 320/325 to dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields were up at close on Thursday following, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 closed at 31.70/80 percent on Thursday, up from 29.95/30.05 percent on Wednesday.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 27.00/27.40 percent, up from 26.10/25 percent.
Bond yields rose amid profit taking and due to a bond auction coming up.

State debt office said, 70,000 million Treasury Bonds under the series of 22.00 percent 2024’A’ and 110,000 million Treasury Bonds under the series of 18.00 percent 2027 ‘A’ are to be issued through an auction on March 13, 2023. (Colombo/Mar 09/2023)
